newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Options steal the SFE wheat futures scene.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Options steal the SFE wheat futures scene.

text.p: Options trading again set the pace on the Sydney Futures Exchange on Wednesday.
A total of 20 January 1997 call options traded, one in the A$200.00 option at a A$10.00 premium and 19 in the A$205.00 option at A$7.00.
This compared with only three trades in futures, all in the January 1997 contract which fell A$4.00 to A$193.00 on the deal.
Edward Scamps of Elders Risk Management Pty Ltd said he had traded a few call options for growers who felt the market would rise.
Scamps also said SFE futures were basically still following Chicago, which he said was jumping like a yo-yo on different weather reports.
There was further likely downside to come with harvest pressure, but later the fundamental tightness of stocks was likely to produce a rally about Australian harvest time, he said.
Australia wheat futures on Aug 21 (A$ per tonne)
